sections.text: Vasile Pătraşcu, The Neutrosophic Entropy and its Five Components Value Representation for Neutrosophic Entropy. The first is an extension of Kaufmann's formula and the second is an extension of Kosko's formulas. Based on the primary trivalent information expressed by the degree of truth, the degree of falsehood and the degree of neutrality, some Penta-rated representations are created that better highlight some specific features of Neutrosophic Entropy. Therefore, we also highlight five features of Neutrosophic uncertainty, such as ambiguity, ignorance, contradiction, neutrality and saturation. These five features are supplemented up to a sevenfold division of the unit by adding two features of Neutrosophic certainty, such as truth and falsehood.

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: Neutrosophical representation of information was proposed by Smarandache [10], [11], [12] as an extension of the neutral representation proposed by Zadeh [16] and the intuitionist neutral representation proposed by Atanassov [1], [2]. Primary Neutrosophical information is defined by three parameters: degree of truth, degree of falsehood, and degree of neutrality. Blurred representation is described by a single parameter, the degree of truth, while the degree of falsehood has an error value calculated by a negation formula: 1 (1,1) and the degree of neutrality has a default value of 0. Blurred intuitionist representation is described by two explicit parameters, the degree of truth and the degree of falsehood, while the degree of falsehood has a default value of 0. Atanassov considered the incomplete variant of neutrality taking into account 1. This enabled indexity (incompleteness): 1.

sections.text: The five components of neutrosophical entropy will be: ambiguity a, ignorance u, contradiction c, neutrality n and saturation s [6]. We construct formulas for these characteristics both for the formula defined by the formula (2,4) and for the variant defined by the formula (2,12). Furthermore, we consider point 5.00,5.0A, which is halfway between point U (unknown) and point C (contradiction).This point, too, is halfway between point F (false) and point T (true).

sections.heading: 4 Conclusion
sections.text: In this article, two formulas are constructed for the calculation of neutrosophical entropy: For each of these components, five are defined, which are related to the following characteristics of neutrosophical uncertainty: ambiguity, ignorance, contradiction, neutrality and saturation. In addition, two components for neutrosophical security are constructed: truth and falsehood. All seven components, five of uncertainty and two of certainty form a division of unity. By constructing these seven components, the primary neutrosophical information is transformed into a more nuanced representation.

metadata.abstractText: This paper presents two variants of pentavalued representation for neutrosophic entropy. The first is an extension of Kaufmann's formula and the second is an extension of Kosko's formula. Based on the primary three-valued information represented by the degree of truth, degree of falsity and degree of neutrality there are built some penta-valued representations that better highlights some specific features of neutrosophic entropy. Thus, we highlight five features of neutrosophic uncertainty such as ambiguity, ignorance, contradiction, neutrality and saturation. These five features are supplemented until a seven partition of unity by adding two features of neutrosophic certainty such as truth and falsity. The paper also presents the particular forms of neutrosophic entropy obtained in the case of bifuzzy representations, intuitionistic fuzzy representations, paraconsistent fuzzy representations and finally the case of fuzzy representations.
